sentences.english: He's deeply engrossed in physical research.
sentences.chinese: 他醉心於物理學的研究。

sentences.english: Jim considers himself a 'political junkie' and loves listening to talk radio.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆認爲自己“醉心政治”，喜歡聽之聲訪談。

sentences.english: Being rapt in writing was something prehistorical for me till then.
sentences.chinese: 醉心寫作已成爲乾隆年間的事了。

sentences.english: He remained gloomy, narrow and hopelessly addicted to conventional wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 他依舊陰鬱，險隘，無可救藥地醉心於傳統的智慧中。

sentences.english: How I wish to retain the innocent years and play intoxicating morning melody permanently .
sentences.chinese: 多想留住天真的年華，就這樣永遠彈奏醉心的晨曲。

sentences.english: Rothschild is revelling in the fruits of its conservatism.
sentences.chinese: 洛希爾醉心於保守理念帶來的甜頭兒。

sentences.english: My old friend and old comrade Dato' Hon Choon Kim indulges in photography.
sentences.chinese: 最近我的老戰友及老朋友拿督韓春錦非常醉心予攝影。

sentences.english: Jack is enamoured with scientific researches.

definition: to admire wholeheartedly/to fall in love with
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
to loiter (i.e. reluctant to leave)/to linger on
to be keen on/to have a passion for
to be infatuated with/to be drunk with/to be enchanted with/to revel in
to fall in love/to love sb or sth dearly (lover, or art)
